alert.note: Alert for Harmon; Jackson (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 8:12PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Gusty winds will impact portions of western Jackson, southeastern Harmon, south central Greer, northwestern Foard and central Hardeman Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 812 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Duke to 5 miles west of Eldorado to 4 miles north of Goodlett to 12 miles southwest of Quanah to 5 miles north of Chalk. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Quanah, Eldorado, Martha, Goodlett, Duke, Copper Breaks State Park and McQueen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
